sub_title: researcher and M&E consultant in international development / university lecturer statistics & research methods
summary:
As an independent researcher and M&E consultant, I work with international organizations to tackle methodology and data issues in various - oftentimes challenging - environments. In the past, I have worked on evaluation and survey projects in regions such as Rwanda, Eastern DRC, Tanzania, Ghana, Gaza and Myanmar with different NGOs and the World Bank.

As a part-time/renegade academic, I teach statistics and research methods at the University of Amsterdam (PPLE College). 

I hold a PhD from the Erasmus Research Centre for Media, Communication and Culture (Rotterdam University) and a Social Sciences Research Master (University of Amsterdam).
